titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Barbara Guest Papers
titlestmt.author: By Beinecke staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday April 23, 2019 at 03:47

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The Barbara Guest Papers is open for research.
Boxes 144-152 (audiovisual material): Restricted fragile material. Consult Access Services for further information.
Boxes 153-154 (born digital material): Restricted fragile material. Access copies of digital files may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from James S. Jaffe on the Eugene G. O'Neill Memorial Fund, the George B. Alvord Fund, the Danford N. Barney, Jr. Fund, the Sinclair Lewis Fund, and the Ezra Pound Archive Fund, 1993.
Purchased from Granary Books on the Ezra Pound Archive Fund, 1997.
Purchased from James J. Jaffee on the Sinclair Lewis Fund, 2002.
Purchased from James S. Jaffe on the Alfred Z. Baker, Jr. Fund, the Sinclair Lewis Fund, the Thornton Wilder Memorial Fund, 2007.
Purchased from James S. Jaffe on the Elizabeth Wakeman Dwight Memorial Fund, 2008.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into nine series: I. Correspondence, 1940-2006. II. Writings, 1953-2004. III. Personal Papers, 1943-2006. IV. Professional Papers, X. V. Photographs, circa 1923-2004. VI. Artwork, 1953-1995. VII. Printed Material, 1960-2004. VIII. Audiovisual Material, 1963-2000. IX. Born Digital Material, 1983-2006.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Barbara Guest Papers. Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Former call numbers are Uncat MSS 402, Uncat MSS 947, Uncat MSS 1025, Uncat ZA MS 271, and Uncat ZA MS 544.
Unless a folder title contains the title of an artistic work, all quotations represent folder title supplied by Guest.
This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection and/or revisions in arrangement and description.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Barbara Guest Papers span 1923 to 2006 and document Guest's life as a prominent American poet, her personal and professional relationships with other writers, and her personal life as a wife, mother, and friend. The papers include drafts of writings, correspondence, personal and professional papers, photographs, artwork, printed material, audiovisual material, born digital material, artwork, and a typewriter.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Barbara Guest Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Barbara Guest, American author. Guest was born Barbara Pinson in Wilmington, North Carolina on September 6, 1920. She died on February 15, 2006 in Berkeley, California.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into two subseries: General correspondence and Other correspondence

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence includes correspondence with friends, family, colleagues, and other individuals, relating to Guest's professional and personal life.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: General correspondence subseries contains letters from individuals to Guest. Correspondents notably represented are Johannes Bellharz, Mei-Mei Berssenbrugge, Susan Clark, Robert Dash, Double Day & Company, Anne Dunn, Rachel Blau DuPlessis, Helen Frankenthaler, Kathleen Fraser, and Rena Rosenwasser. Enclosures such as writing drafts and photographs are noted when present.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by correspondent's last name.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Other correspondence subseries contains family correspondence kept by Guest, including letters from her children, Hadley and Jonathan; drafts and unsent letters from Guest to various individuals; correspondence related to specific topics and correspondents grouped together by Guest; and postcards kept by Guest. Third party and unidentified correspondence are filed at the end of the subseries. Enclosures are noted when present.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

Higgings, an unidentified note, menu for event, Hotel Rembrandt receipt, The Allen-Stevenson School brochure, and typed note from Higgins to Guest.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into two subseries: Writings by Guest and Writings by others

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains writings by Guest and writings of others. Writings by Guest includes drafts of her poetry, prose, drama, essays, lectures, lectures and reviews, and her biography on H.D. entitled Herself Defined: The Poet H.D. and Her World ; and notes on kept by her throughout her writing process. Writings by others includes drafts by others that were sent to Guest for critique or are on Guest herself, reviews of Guest's published work, or are interviews with Guest.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into eight groupings: Poetry, Prose, Drama, Essays, Herself Defined: The Poet H. D. and Her World, Notes, Lectures by Guest, and Other writings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Poetry contains drafts of Guest's poems. Notable poetry publications represented include Bandusia , Blurred Edge , The Countess from Minneapolis , Defensive Rapture , Minatures and Other Poems , Poems , and Quilts . Drafts grouped together by Guest and unsorted poetry drafts and related papers are filed at the end of the subseries.
Prose contains drafts of Guest's prose writings, including her novel, Seeking Air , and her prose poetry work, Rocks on a Platter: Notes on Literature.
Drama contains Guest's dramatic writings, including "The Execution of Mary Stewart", "The Lady's Choice" and "The Office".
Essays contains notebooks of essay drafts kept and titled by Guest, "Notebooks 1-8", and other essays, including essays on H.D. and other artists and writers.
Herself Defined: The Poet H. D. and Her World contains correspondence, research notes, photographs, and working drafts of Guest's notable biography on H.D.
Also in the subseries are various notes kept by Guest, lectures written and presented by Guest upon invitation, reviews by Guest on others' works, and drafts of Guest's bibliography.
Material in this subseries includes handwritten, typescript, and composite drafts. Enclosures are noted when present.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Writings by others contains writing drafts of others that various writers shared with Guest. Most notable among the subseries are writings by Mei-Mei Berssenbrugge and Sara Lundquist. Many of the writings are on Guest and her writing. Guest organized essays about herself together and these folders are filed at the end of the subseries.
Also in the subseries are reviews on works by Guest and interview with Guest.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into three subseries: Dayplanners and calendars, Diaries and notebooks, and Other papers

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Personal Papers includes dayplanners, calendars, diaries, and notebooks kept by Guest. They are all dated. Other papers include material relating to Guest's death and funeral and services, such as writings on Guest that were shared during her memorial service, the guest book for her funeral, and various printed obituaries. Also present is material collected by Guest relating to her family's history and genealogy.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged chronologically. An undated dayplanner is filed at the end of the subseries.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The material in this series was previously arranged into folders and various groupings by Guest. Specific subjects and meaningful order were not discernable and therefore folder labels were not created. Further processing is required.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series includes groupings of material prepared by Guest, including printed material, correspondence, writings drafts, and other papers relating to Guest's professional life.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is organized into four subseries: Photographs of Guest and others, Portraits, Photograph albums, and "Photographs A-Z".

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photographs of Guest contains photographs of Guest, her immediate and extended family, friends, colleagues, and other individuals. Portraits are primarily of Guest but portraits of others are present. Photograph albums are of family and friends, Guest's celebration of her Festschrfit at Bonn University, and a photograph album of Guest's plays being performed. "Photographs A-Z" contains photographs foldered and arranged alphebtically by Guest. These photographs depict Guest, her family, friends and landscapes.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This subseries was arranged according to how photographs were grouped together upon acquisition.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically by artist. A notebook is filed at the end.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains artwork by several artists. One work is a comic collaboration between Guest and Joe Brainard and the other works were created by or for Guest to use as published cover art.

did.unittitle: Brainard, Joe and Barbara Guest. Comic
Dunn, Ann. Original art for Stripped Tales
Dunn, Ann. Paintings for "The Magic City Series"
Dunn, Ann. Artwork for "If So, Tell Me"
Guest, Barbara. Collage for Rocks on a Platter bookjacket

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into two subseries: Publications related to Guest and Printed material collected by Guest

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains printed material related to Guest and printed material assembled by Guest.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into four subseries: Reel-to-reel audiotapes, Audiocassettes, Videocassettes, and Sound discs.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Boxes 144-152 (audiovisual material): Restricted fragile material. Consult Access Services for further information.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: All titles are transcribed from labels on the material.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series includes reel-to-reel audiotapes, audiocassettes, videocassettes, and phonograph records. The material contains readings, interviews, research material, and other related content.
